ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing coupon, dividend, interest payments.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.

desc.p: Specifies "Own Account Trading/Investment" portfolio.
Y or blank
Used for storing the 'Bank's' standard minimum commission on any payment within this application.
1-15 character Standard amount format. Optional input.
Transaction code for all Foreign Charges which are to be 'credited' to a client with the Dividend/Interest payment section.
For "credit" read Reversal (cancellation).
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Default category code for all foreign charges payable/chargeable by the Depository involved in any coupon/div interest payment.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that given an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Category Code.
The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Profits.
To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following range has been assigned within T24:
600 - 649 = Securities.

Mandatory input.

Must be the key to a valid entry on the TRANSACTION file.
Internal suspense account used for processing Dividend payment accounting entries.

While all client credits are posted to their appropriate account number the corresponding Dr will rest on this suspense account until all entries for that particular payment are authorised; whereupon it will be posted to the relevant nostro account.
1-10 Alpha numeric characters. Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Account Class Code.
Default commission rate for all payments within this application.

This rate will automatically default to field 14 (commission percentage) on the Dividend Detail record being input. However as with all standard default commission and brokerage rates it can be altered at transaction level.
1-15 character Standard Rate format. Up to 6 integers and decimal points. Optional input.

Mandatory Input.
If entered this will be the value adopted as the standard for all normal dividend transactions.
Note: Great care should be taken when setting up these defaults since the nominee forms part of the key under which security positions are stored.
1-5 Alpha numeric character nominee code. Optional input.
Must exist as a valid Nominee Code.
Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application.

9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
A maximum of 16 characters may be entered.
